cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles W of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend and then inland across north-Florida into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend coast of Florida near the Suwannee River/Cedar Key area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the immediate Tampa Bay/Manatee County area; hurricane watch begins north at Anclote River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect Englewood to Suwannee River (includes Tampa Bay and Manatee County Port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Longboat Key northward through the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 kt, higher gusts) possible in the afternoon and evening of 1 Sep, easing early 2 Sep.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in and near Tampa Bay and along the coast south to Longboat Key, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain (2–4 in.) with localized higher totals; flash-flood threat mainly north of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding during high tide cycles; hazardous seas and strong currents in Tampa Bay entrance.
